subject: Re: [junit] How to test a static private function
msgSnippet: ... First step: make the method public. Now you can test it. If this is not a possibility, then try PrivateAccessor, part of junit-addons (Google for the
messageBody:
Prasad wrote:
> hi everybody,
>
> Iam new to JUnit.I have to test a static private function.
> So could you please help me out in writing test cases for it.

First step: make the method public. Now you can test it.

If this is not a possibility, then try PrivateAccessor, part of
junit-addons (Google for the project page). It should be able to help you.

Good luck.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
